AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: Defendant convicted of aiding and abetting the transportation of undocumented aliens, subject of a suppression motion regarding the stop and search of her vehicle, driver of the stopped pickup camper, appellant in the current case, appellant contesting the district court's refusal to allow post-verdict discovery through juror depositions, truck owner, driver of the truck, makes an assertion about the passengers' actions, owner of the camper, vehicle was traveling at forty to forty-five miles per hour
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.GARWOOD: Circuit Judge presiding over the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, received specialized training as a border patrol agent, served for two years and five months prior to the events in question, had limited Spanish language skills
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35, received specialized training as a border patrol agent, served for slightly over three years prior to the events in question, native Spanish speaker, participated in approximately 150 separate incidents involving arrests for transporting illegal aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron: Agents who jointly conducted the field investigation and observed the suspicious vehicle, applied the Brignoni-Ponce standard in their assessment, had reason to suspect the presence of illegal aliens due to various factors including the vehicle's appearance and occupant behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce: Namesake of a test regarding reason to believe a vehicle came from the border, used as a standard for suspicion in this case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia, Lourdes Rangel-Ca: Individuals present in the vehicle stopped by agents Pruszenski and Baron, exhibited suspicious behavior when approached by border patrol agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.TATE: Circuit Judge dissenting in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Allen: Reference to a properly given charge related to jury coercion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the appellant: Appellant in the current case, contesting the district court's refusal to allow post-verdict discovery through juror depositions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pena-Cantu: involved in a comparison of passenger conduct
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Lamas: involved in a comparison of passenger conduct
